Class angryState

java.lang.Object
classes.angryState
All Implemented Interfaces:
State
public class angryState extends Object implements State
The angryState class represents the pet being angry. In this state, the pet only responds to happiness-increasing commands (gift and play). Other commands are disabled until the pet's happiness is restored. When happiness reaches 50 or higher, the pet exits this state.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Darsh Srikanth

    • checkHappinessRecovery

      public void checkHappinessRecovery()
      Checks whether the pet has recovered from the angry state. If happiness is 50 or more, it updates the vitals to potentially exit the state.
